title: feat: add admin-to-user and user-to-user communication via gift wraps
body:
- Add dmtouser command: send gift wrapped messages between users using trade keys from order IDs
  - Add admsenddm command: admin can send gift wrapped messages to users
  - Add getdmuser command: view gift wrapped messages received on trade keys 
  - Filter messages by sender: getdm shows only Mostro messages (admin sends messages with mostro key), getdmuser shows only user messages

  New commands:
  - mostro-cli dmtouser -p <pubkey> -o <order_id> -m <message>
  - mostro-cli admsenddm -p <pubkey> -m <message>
  - mostro-cli getdmuser -s <minutes>

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - New CLI commands to send user-linked DMs, send admin DMs, and retrieve user DMs since a given time.
  - Added gift-wrapped DM sending and multi-key DM retrieval.
  - Retrieved DMs are shown in a readable table (time, sender, message).

- Improvements
  - Mostro-aware filtering threaded through DM retrieval for more accurate results and clearer output.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Rate user
body:
Hi @grunch ,

replacing closed #100 with this new Pr.

Added some fix for user rating above nip59 removal.

Pasting below comment from #100 as reminder:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Remove of `nip59.rs` mod

testing to replace lot of lines of code with internal Sdk functions:

- Added a cleaner way to fetch events removing old code to do that.
- Tested a full cycle of sell order with new nip59 functions directly from sdk with success.
- Need to understand if we can manage also user messages in similar way.

Temporary note: 

At the moment to make this compile we need to point to Nost-sdk in `cargo.toml` of `mostro-cli` and `mostro-core` like this:

```Rust
nostr-sdk = { git  = "https://github.com/rust-nostr/nostr", features = ["nip06", "nip44", "nip59"], rev ="70db575d51965240aab1e1b3f1edab782c0ef625"}
```
and also use a local override of `mostro-core` to point to same nostr-sdk like, this:

```Rust
[patch.crates-io]
mostro-core = { path = "../mostro-core" }
```
these 2 patches can be removed as soon as new release of sdk has been shipped.

title: Final code on sending messages
body:
All messages to mostro are being sent using nip59

Messages between parties are simple nostr messages kind 14 encrypted with nip44 between two parties, users should use ephemeral keys to send this messages.
User can get the conversation key of this messages and delivered to an admin in case of a dispute, this way the admin can see the history of the chat between parties

title: Allow use initial vars as args
Big refactor for KO relays issue on nip33 message listing
body:
Hi @grunch ,

big refactoring of command for listing orders and disputes, as pointed out from a tg user yesteday there were some strange behaviour on orders showed in web interface, going a bit deeper with analysis I discovered some issue due to async in states of NIP33 messages. We know that Nostr relays are dumb, so we need to move "smartness" on client side.

What happened is this picture below, same order has `pending `state and `canceled `state:
![image](https://github.com/MostroP2P/mostro-cli/assets/113362043/960bda07-4cf0-4ea9-a1d0-88f35dee3fe2)

what happened imo is that order was created, let me say, with all relay correctly up and running, then user canceled order from mostro intreface after some time, this time not all relays were ok, so on the active ones NIP33 correctly updated the event, but not on unresponsive ones. Now requesting event from CLI or web lead to the issue showed in the image: that order has not be visualize on the interface, but the pending one still shows up, mostro need to just the most recent order if some shows up with same ID!

Ok...

@grunch after that showed me on tg that also CLI could have the same problem and yesterday I tried to fight with relays issue and i drop here an untested idea to solve it ( i am in office and they fuck me up connections with relays ).
What CLI tries to do now is:

- Request all events on mostro custom Kind ( no more filtering for status )
- Collect all events
- Order events by id
- Check duplicate id and prepare to remove the older duplicates

Not so easy to do, but I got a starting point to test in this PR, meanwhile think about this issue also in webclient, in the case above web mostro must discard pending order.

Edge case:

- order create ( all relays ok)
- order cancel ( some relays KO )
- Listorders
- Now relays that were aligned are down and unaligned one respond with wrong order

title: Avoid duplicated id when listing disputes
small fixes on listorders
body:
Hi @grunch ,

before diving in scheduler new feature I was lookin a bit to what Catrya said about duplicate order.
I added a protection on `listorders` to avoid duplicate Uuid in the list, we should have only one in the table.
Then i saw that also sorting is not always the same so I copied the idea of sorting on creation time the table: nearer in time order on top.

Let me know if you think it's good!

title: Refactor CLI structure for reusability and maintainability
body:
This PR separates the CLI code into a dedicated `cli` module, making it more modular and reusable for future clients. The original code was mostly contained in main.rs, which has now been refactored to improve code organization and maintainability.

The changes in Cargo.toml ensure the proper linking of the new library and binary.

By refactoring the CLI structure, we improve code maintainability and make it easier to extend the application to other clients in the future. One such intention is to use the application logic through FFI in a client built with Flutter.

title: Added check from API of Yadio for fiat currency
body: Hi @grunch ! Added a check on fiat currency list on CLI side. If user is selecting a Fiat not present in the list he's forced to add -a flag.

title: New management of takesell
body:
Hi @grunch !

Did some work on takesell:

- Now after takesell from cli i wait for dm of last minute in time and automatically retrieve them, here is the waiting part: https://github.com/arkanoider/mostro-cli/blob/3fb9d57acf05aa059e25995d7443e30d8ec824cc/src/util.rs#L97
- Not using pretty table for takesell printout on cli, easier to copy hold invoice.

I left getdm with prettytable at the moment, but if you are startint to "jsonize" all dm of mostro we can parse better all the fields!

Let me know boss!

title: Order preview draft
body:
Hi @grunch finally i found some time to move on.

Give a look at this draft idea or order preview, lot to do to have more clean code, but it's working. 
You can create the order and check the preview, I have to test a lot of things, but the basics are workin.

I forced to wait connection to relays to avoid info messages before order, but surely a cleaner solution is possible.

Let me know!

title: neworder cmd first usable version
body:
Hi @grunch ! Here the first neworder cmd usable version.

I have been able to add orders like a charm.
Things to do:

- Add the min, max logic to sats number.
- Check if we always exit from the waiting OK loop, one time seemed to get stuck.
